data: Creates a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to each word sense (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text snippets, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better understand, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, with over 10,700 news headlines, provides insight into sentiment variation depending on specific entities in financial news.

A tokenized and annotated dataset from speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts of the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

An annotated dataset of relationships in financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, org-money), extracted from SEC 10-X filings. Useful for discovering inter-entity relationships in financial reports.
Collected from diverse news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines affect price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial landscape, helping to discover and classify financial companies in text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.

A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning about financial data, providing training data for answering complex financial questions.
